body:
Hi @SeanFarrow This suggestion seems useful for both reasons: happy to take a PR.

I'm thinking `IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, IsPolicy>>` would be what it should implement (following the pattern of the dictionary-like semantics it already exposes).

Re:
>what tests would be warranted?

Polly's own concrete implementation `PolicyRegistry` [implements `IReadOnlyPolicyRegistry<string>` indirectly](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/blob/9a9da0437f368013b6a58eb673e42e5efea2bfea/src/Polly.Shared/Registry/PolicyRegistry.cs#L11), so it would certainly be necessary for the concrete `PolicyRegistry` to be extended to fulfil `IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, IsPolicy>>`, and for tests on that.  It could be nice also to have a test demonstrating the collection initializer syntax.

@reisenberger ,
That all makes sense. Having looked at the specs, I notice you are testing the IReadOnlyPolicyRegistry using integration-style tests. Should we test the IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, IsPolicy>> using mocks?
Essentially, I’d like to test that the  internal dictionaries GetEnumerator method is called.
We can then have a test that check that the collection initializer functionality is working as you suggest.
Happy with using Moq for this.

Ok, I’ll sort this in the next day or so.

What is the next planned version of Polly?

>What is the next planned version of Polly?

We could probably put out a next release (with this, 513 and 517) late this week or early next.  (I will scope 499/508 out of that release as dev time is longer)
Ok, I’ll work on this tomorrow.
I realise this is a breaking change, so would have to wait until V7.

@SeanFarrow I am working towards a major release (v7) of Polly for first weeks of January.  If you wish to pick up this issue again and make a PR, we'd be happy to include that in V7.

To answer some previous points, re:

>With the current design of IReadOnlyPolicyRegistry, we can't implement IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, ISPolicy>> as the T of IEnumerable is an out parameter and we are using TKey as an in.

Happy to drop that `out` restriction for v7.

Re:

>Would it make sense to restrict the `IReadOnlyPolicyRegistry` to use a string. Is there any reason why someone would use another type as the key?

I don't think we _need_ to restrict to string keys, to deliver the `IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, ISPolicy>>` and thus collection-initializer functionality. Let me know if there's something I'm missing, though.

@ Reisenberger
How early is “early January”?
If we drop the out requirement, then this should work, we don’t need to restrict to string.
Cheers
Sean.

Hi Sean. Re:

>How early is “early January”?

A PR #552 is up to form the baseline for v7.0.0 (large PR, but doesn't affect PolicyRegistry); I expect to merge that likely tomorrow; you could target policy registry changes onto the [v7.0.0 branch](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/tree/v700) any time after that merge.  A goal is to publish v7 on Jan 5th or 6th, but it depends how my times falls - it could become a later weekend in Jan.

Hi Dylan,

Can you let me know when this has been murged.
I’ll update my fork and work on this early next week.
Is there a list as to what has changed for V7?
Cheers
Sean.

Hi Sean.  #552 has now been merged to the [v7.0.0 branch](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/tree/v700) and you can target any policy registry work onto that branch.

Re:

>Is there a list as to what has changed for V7?

Yep. Our usual [changelog](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/blob/v700/CHANGELOG.md#700) covers this.  In short:

+ A new route to creating custom policies outside Polly - doco to follow
+ Clarification of the sync/async split: full doco [already on wiki](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/wiki/Polly-v7-breaking-changes)
